user.title: ğŸ”— Add Homie Proxy Instance
user.description:
Create a new HTTP proxy instance with custom access controls and restrictions.

**Your proxy endpoint will be:**
`{sample_endpoint}`

**Outbound Restrictions:**
â€¢ **Allow all destinations** - No restrictions on target URLs
â€¢ **Private networks only** - {private_networks}
â€¢ **Local network only** - {local_network}
â€¢ **Custom CIDR range** - Specify your own network range

data_description.name: A unique name for this proxy instance (e.g., 'external-api', 'development', 'restricted')
data_description.restrict_out: Controls which destinations this proxy can access
data_description.restrict_out_custom: Required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above. Use CIDR notation (e.g., 10.0.0.0/8, 203.0.113.0/24)
data_description.restrict_in: Optional: Limit which client IPs can use this proxy (CIDR format, e.g., 192.168.1.0/24)

error.name_exists: âŒ An instance with this name already exists. Please choose a different name.
error.invalid_cidr: âŒ Invalid CIDR notation. Please use format like 192.168.1.0/24 or 10.0.0.0/8
error.custom_cidr_required: âŒ Custom CIDR range is required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above

init.description: Choose what you want to configure:

restrictions.title: ğŸŒ Configure Access Restrictions

data_description.restrict_out: Controls which destinations this proxy can access
data_description.restrict_out_custom: Required when 'Custom CIDR range' is selected above. Use CIDR notation (e.g., 10.0.0.0/8, 203.0.113.0/24)

add_token.title: ğŸ”‘ Add New Access Token
add_token.description:
A new access token will be generated:

**New Token:** `{new_token}`

**New Endpoint:** `{new_endpoint}`

Confirm to add this token to your instance.

remove_token.title: ğŸ—‘ï¸ Remove Access Token
remove_token.description:
**Warning:** Removing a token will immediately disable access for any applications using it.

Currently managing {token_count} token(s). Select the token to remove:
